alert.note: Alert for Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 07 at 9:52PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Monterey Bay through 1030 PM PST... At 951 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over near Carmel-By-The-Sea, or 8 miles southwest of Monterey, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seaside, Monterey, Pacific Grove, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Del Monte Forest, Del Rey Oaks and Sand City. This includes Highway 1 between Mile Markers 65 and 75. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
